concept.title: Disk I/O priority
concept.shortdesc: Disk I/O priority allows workload priorities to be set at the bucket level.

conbody.p: Bucket priority settings can be specified at the bucket-level. The bucket disk I/O priority can be set as either high or low, whereas, low is the default. Bucket priority settings determine the number of threads assigned to a bucket allocated resources across buckets. Bucket latency and I/O operations are impacted by the setting value. When a bucket has a high priority, additional I/O resources are assigned for processing tasks.
The default buckets settings can be set during initial setup as well as be edited after setup.

section.title: Backward compatibility
section.p: When upgrading from a 2.x release to a 3.x release, Couchbase converts an existing thread value to either a low or a high priority based on the following:

ul.li: Buckets allocated six to eight (6-8) threads are high priority.
Buckets allocated three to five (3-5) threads are low priority.
